data: PED NEPH Peritoneal Diaylsis Suspected Peritonitis
For patients presenting with signs and symptoms of peritonitis (abdominal pain, cloudy dialysate or a dialysate white cell count of more than 100 mega/L with greater than 50% PMNs)
If patient has PD fluid in abdomen, ensure at least 2 hours dwell prior to taking samples
If patient does not have PD fluid in abdomen, instill dialysate and dwell for 2 hours prior to taking sample
Refer to Peritoneal Dialysis Peritonitis Specimen Collection Policy
If cloudy dialysate collect immediately. If equivical then 2 hours dwell and collect after

If/when Abdominal pain, cloudy dialysate, fever or temperature greater than 38 DegC, then notify treating provider to order labs, and activate PED NEPH Peritoneal Diaylsis Suspected Peritonitis PowerPlan
